page.title: 05White Notley station
page.content: The train is quite important to the people of White Notley because there is no daily bus service to Witham or Braintree. (Only on Wednesdays and Saturdays). The railway line is a single track which links Witham, on the main line to London, with Braintree. The line was planned in 1845 to go all the way from Braintree to Maldon but this has never happened. The 6.25 mile long section was opened in 1848 with stations at White Notley and Bulford (now called Cressing). All sorts of problems have happened including lack of money and lack of use and it was thought for a long time that the line would be closed altogether, (some extensions have been). Braintree developed as a commuter town during the 1960s and this is probably the main reason that
